item.title: Keeping Up with ArXiv using Sxolar
item.author: jameswkennington@psu.edu (Jim Kennington)
item.description: Overview & Motivation Like many researchers, I use ArXiv to keep up with the latest research in my field. However, I find it difficult to keep track of all the new papers that are posted each day. I have explored many of the existing tools for tracking ArXiv, but I have not found one that meets my simple requirements. All I wanted was a tool that would let me configure a set of queries, and send me period emails with the new papers that match those queries.

item.title: Quick Python Setup
item.author: jameswkennington@psu.edu (Jim Kennington)
item.description: Motivation Python has increased in popularity to near ubiquity in the past five years. While the Python community (correctly) professes simplicity as a major accomplishment of the language, I still get a lot of questions about how to get a python environment setup properly. There are some lengthy guides out there on this - this post will aim to summarize and explain the relevant components to getting started. Note: skip to bottom if you want quick install commands
